meanings.definition: In a rude or bad-tempered manner.
meanings.sent1: She answered surlily when asked about her day.
meanings.sent2: He always speaks surlily to his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed surlily when it was time for a bath.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered surlily in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The old man glared surlily at the noisy children.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of friendliness or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: The surlily waiter barely acknowledged our presence.
meanings.sent2: She received a surlily written response to her invitation.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail surlily as if it didn't really care.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden drooped surlily in the heat.
meanings.sent5: The tired traveler gave a surlily smile to the innkeeper.
